direction.raw_text: Remember Archimedes of Syracuse? The King asks Archimedes to determine if a present he's received was actually solid gold. Unsolved problem at the time. It tortures the great Greek mathematician for weeks. Insomnia haunts him and he twists and turns on his bed for nights on end. Finally, his equally exhausted wife, she's forced to share a bed with this genius, convinces him to take a bath, to relax. While stepping into the tub he observes the bathwater rise as he enters. Displacement. A way to determine volume. And thus, a way to determine density, weight over volume. And thus, Archimedes solves the problem. In a wild rage, he smashes it and punches it. Then he drops the drill and uses his bare hands to shove it down the drain. Screaming like a madman, he jams it until it is gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A wise-looking, bearded Hasidic man with benevolent, piercing eyes stands tenderly over Max. He wears traditional black clothes. Lenny Meyer paces nervously in the background. As Max comes through, RAV COHEN speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Max, Max. You're okay I'm Rabbi Cohen. Cohen like you. I'm sorry for what Lenny did, he's been reprimanded. It is not our way Are you okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, yeah
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything will be fine, Max. You need to give us the number. Do you have it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you we don't know
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wouldn't be so flipped out if you didn't know. What's happening to me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give us the number!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Screw you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, okay! Lenny, easy! Max, I'll tell you what's going on. Just calm down. (Deep breath, then) The Talmud tells us it began two thousand years ago, when the Romans destroyed the second temple.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just give me a chance. You'll understand everything if you listen. Max takes out his pills and starts feeding himself some.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Romans also murdered all of our priest- hoodthe Cohanimthe Cohens, and with their deaths they destroyed our greatest secret. In the center of the great temple was the holy of holies which was the heart of Jewish life. This was the earthly residence for our God. The one God. It contained the ark of the Tabernacle which stored the original Ten Commandments that God gave to Moses. Only one man could enter this space once a year on the holiest day of the year, Yom Kippur On the Day of Atonement, all of Israel would descend upon Jerusalem to witness the High Cohen's trip into the holy of holies. If the holy man was pure he would reemerge a few moments later and Israel was secured a prosperous year. It meant that we were one yea r closer to the messianic age. Closer to the return of the Garden of Eden. But if he was impure, he would die instantly and it meant that we were doomed. The High Cohen had a single ritual to perform in the holy of holies. He had to intone a single word. Rav Cohen takes a dramatic pause. Max is anxious to hear the end of the story.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That word was the true name of God.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The true name, which only the Cohanim knew, was two hundred and sixteen letters long. A long beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're telling me that the number in my head is the name of God!? Wondrously, Max rubs the scar on his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes...it's The key into the messianic age. As the Romans burned the temple, the Talmud says, the High Cohen walked into the flames. He took his secret to the top of the burning building. The heavens opened up and took the key from the priest's outstretched hand. We've been searching for the key ever since. And you may have found it. Now let us find out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what happened. I saw God.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no, Max. You're not pure. You can't see God unless you're pure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's more than God... it s everything. It's math and science and nature... the universe. I saw the Universe's DNA RAV COHEN You saw nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I saw everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's much more. We can unlock the door with the key. It will show God that we are pure again. He will return us to The Garden.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Garden? You're not pure. I'm the one who has the number
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who do you think you are? You are a vessel from our God. You are carrying a delivery that needs to be made to us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was given to me. It's part of me. It's changing me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's killing you. Because you are impure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It will kill you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what will it do to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're pure. Give us the number!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The number is nothing. You know that!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can use it. We can wield it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just a number. I'm sure you've written down every two hundred sixteen number. You've translated all of them. You've intoned them all. Haven't you? But what's it gotten you? It's not the number! It's the meaning. It's the syntax. It's what's between the numbers. If you could understand you would. But it's not for you! I've got it. I understand it. I'm going to see it! (Whispers to Rav Cohen) Rabbi...I was chosen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Max races through the streets of New York. He is wide-eyed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly, it's all there. It all makes sense. I can crack it. I can know it. I know what it is. Sol knows, too. I need to tell him. I need to show him. I need to bring him with me. People fly by. Max in a spiraling whirlwind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A pumped and excited Max paces the hall as he rings the bell. The door opens. But it isn't Sol. It's a young, beautiful woman wearing a simple black dress. Her name is JENNY ROBESON and she is Sol's niece.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I help you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sol?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Were you a friend?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He had a second stroke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is he? Jenny's eyes drop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Max rushes into Sol s study. The room is covered with Sol's P, research books. It seems Sol had recently come out of retirement. Max looks at a few of Sol's books. Then he finds a piece of paper with Sol's handwriting on it. On the paper is THE number. Max slides it into his pocket. Max looks at the Go board. The pieces are arranged in a giant spiral across the board.
direction.name: direction
